question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In analyzing the probabilities for the questions regarding Elon Musk's participation in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and his public statements about Bitcoin in 2024, I consider various factors that may influence these outcomes. 

### Predictions:
1. **P (Elon Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: The probability of this event may be influenced by Musk's prior involvement in Bitcoin events, his public persona, and the significance of the event itself. Given his historical engagement with the Bitcoin community, I estimate this probability to be moderately high.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is the complement of P, and thus its probability will be derived from my estimate of P. If P is high, not_P will be lower.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This question is closely related to P, and I expect it to have a similar probability since they are asking about the same event. 

4. **Q (Elon Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024)**: Given Musk's history of making statements about Bitcoin, I believe there is a reasonable probability that he will do so at some point in 2024.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q occur)**: This probability will depend on the interaction between P and Q. If both events are likely but not guaranteed, this probability will be lower than either P or Q alone.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q occurs)**: This probability should be higher than both P and Q individually since it captures the occurrence of either event.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurs while P does not)**: This scenario is plausible if Musk makes a statement but does not attend the Nashville event. The probability here will depend on the independence of the two events.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurs given that P occurs)**: This conditional probability should be relatively high if I believe that Musk is more likely to make a statement if he attends the event.

### Consistency Rules:
- The predictions must adhere to the consistency rules provided. For example, the sum of probabilities for P and not_P must equal 1. Similarly, for P_and_Q, it must be less than or equal to both P and Q, and the calculations for P_or_Q and Q_and_not_P must also be consistent with the respective probabilities.

### Independence:
- I consider that P and Q may have some level of independence, but they are not entirely independent since attending the event could influence whether Musk makes a statement about Bitcoin. Therefore, the probabilities will reflect this relationship.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other outcomes will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In assessing the probability estimates for the events regarding Elon Musk's attendance and statements about Bitcoin in 2024, I considered various factors. 

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: Given Musk's previous engagements and interest in Bitcoin, I estimate a moderately high probability that he will attend, reflecting a value of around 0.70.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is simply the complement of P, leading to a value of 0.30.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is closely related to P, so I set it equal at 0.70.

4. **Q (Elon Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024)**: Considering Musk's history of discussing Bitcoin publicly, I estimate a probability of 0.60 for this event.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q occur)**: The probability that both events occur is estimated at 0.42, reflecting a reasonably high correlation between Musk's attendance and his likelihood to discuss Bitcoin.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q occurs)**: This is calculated by considering the probabilities of P and Q occurring independently, leading to a value of 0.82.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurs while not_P occurs)**: I estimate this probability to be lower, around 0.18, as it reflects a situation where Musk makes a statement without attending the conference.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurs given that P occurs)**: This conditional probability is estimated at 0.75, indicating that if Musk attends, he is likely to make a statement about Bitcoin.

In terms of independence, P and Q are not entirely independent; Musk's attendance at the conference may influence his likelihood to make a statement about Bitcoin. However, they are not entirely dependent either, as he can make statements at other events regardless of attendance at this particular conference. 

Overall, the estimates aim to reflect a realistic assessment based on Musk's past behavior and the context of the events in question.

question.title: Will both Mike Pence and Ted Cruz be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Mike Pence and Ted Cruz are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either or both are not selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the questions regarding Elon Musk's attendance and statements related to Bitcoin at the Nashville 2024 event, I will consider the following factors:

1. **P (Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)** - This prediction is based on Elon Musk's past involvement in Bitcoin discussions and events, as well as his public persona. Given his influence in the cryptocurrency space, I estimate a moderate probability of him attending.

2. **not_P (Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)** - This is the complement of P. If I predict a certain probability for P, then not_P will naturally be 1 minus that probability.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)** - This question is closely related to P, and I expect the probability to be roughly the same, as it essentially asks about the same event but in a more general sense.

4. **Q (Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?)** - This prediction will depend on his engagement with Bitcoin throughout the year. Given his history of making statements about Bitcoin, I anticipate a reasonable probability of him making such statements.

5. **P_and_Q (Will both occur: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and makes a public statement about Bitcoin in 2024?)** - The probability of both events happening is likely to be lower than either event happening individually, as they are not guaranteed to coincide.

6. **P_or_Q (Will either occur: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or makes a public statement about Bitcoin in 2024?)** - This probability should be higher than either P or Q alone, as it includes the possibility of one or both events happening.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Will both occur: Elon Musk makes a statement about Bitcoin and does not show up at the Nashville 2024?)** - This considers the scenario where he makes a statement but does not attend, which could be plausible given the timing of events.

8. **Q_given_P (Given that Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will he make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?)** - This conditional probability should be high, as his attendance at the event may increase the likelihood of him making a public statement about Bitcoin. 

In summary, I expect these events to be interrelated, with P and Q influencing each other. The probabilities will be adjusted to ensure consistency with the rules provided.

question.title: Will either Mike Pence or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Mike Pence or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

8. **Q_given_P (Given P occurs, will Q occur?)**: This is a conditional probability. If P occurs, it might increase the likelihood of Q, so I would estimate this at 0.80.
